title: About the FPS in-game after updating the Windows 10 system
body:
So times before when I was playing on league of legends and turn everything to very high except shadows, i get a solid fps around 130-140 when alone and 90 to 80 throughout the game. And then just one day i decided to check some windows 10 update and update the system. After updating I found out that the fps is becoming lower than before but the most important thing is that no matter what graphic settings I set, very high or very low, the fps always stays the same, which never happened before. And many times when there's an auto animation or something else like using abilities, the fps will have a sudden drop and make u feels like u just lagged and usually the fps will turn to 40-50 for a sec at that time, also it start lagging during team fight now which never happened before. I used anti-virus app and also checked my hard-drive status using Lenovo Solution center and everything is fine. Also my driver is up to date. My computer specs are below:
Intel Core i3-3110m 2.40 GHz
8.00 GB Ram(7.82GB usable)
Nvidia Geforce GT 740m
Intel HD Graphics 4000
Also I used the Gt 740m to run the game
Any suggestions on how to fix this problem? It's bugging me for a while and it feels really bad when you just constantly get fps drop.{{item:3070}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

replies.body: Good news! I tried the new thing I found in the fall creators update called Get Help and an agent helped me solve the problem by controlling the computer for me and fixed the issue! Forgot to say thanks to her though...
Btw I used initiate full repair in the client and also restarting the computer many times but it doesn't seems to be solving this issue.

> [{quoted}](name=The 1 above All,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=1TQQdVBL,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-10-30T06:22:20.136+0000)
>
> Btw I used initiate full repair in the client and also restarting the computer many times but it doesn't seems to be solving this issue.

Search for your lol exe with the old league of legends icon (not the client one) in rads>solutions>lol_game_client_sln>releases>0.0.1.194>deploy - folder, then right click on the League of Legends.exe, go to compatibility, then click the "Disable fullscreen optimization" button. Enjoy ;*

Thank you so much, the stuttering decreased a lot and the fps improved a lot too! And I've also heard that many people are experiencing this type of stuttering and fps drop right after the windows 10 creaters update(1703, 1709), so would this type of issue be solved by microsoft  soon?

We've actually noticed another little hangup with the recent Windows 10 Creator Updates in the Game DVR function. It can cause some FPS issues with some games, particularly League for some reason, so make sure that's turned off. Apparently Windows updates will always turn it back on I've heard, so be sure to check for that.

I'm also gonna be saving Grundika's solution in my pocket since it was able to help you!
